author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Hurriyat chairman Syed Ali Geelani on Saturday ruled out chances of the Islamic State (IS) gaining ground in Jammu and Kashmir and described its recent statement on Kashmir “a ploy.” “There are no chances of the presence of IS. If this organisation was on the right path, then the foremost priority would be the liberation of the Masjid-ul-Aqsa from the Israeli occupation,” the 86-year-old said.

Long-pending issue

“The Kashmir issue is a long-pending dispute. The IS is a two or three-year-old organisation and has got engaged in the fight across the globe,” said Mr. Geelani.

He said “many in India were trying to link the freedom struggle of Kashmir with terrorism.”

“The policy-makers of New Delhi have already started to play the IS card against Muslim youths in India and want to extend to Kashmir so it gets a cover for the atrocities,” alleged Mr. Geelani.
title: No IS presence in J&K, says Geelani
